conclusion: Apply principles of mechanics and electromagnetism to calculate velocity of rod b using given conditions.

Determine magnetic force on each rod: Magnetic force on rod a is 0.6 N; Magnetic force on rod b is 0 N.
Apply equation of motion for rod a: Calculate acceleration as 2.0 m/s².
Solve for velocity of rod b using equation of motion: Acceleration is 0, indicating constant velocity.
Since acceleration of rod b is 0, its velocity remains constant at 1.0 m/s.
Calculate final velocity of rod b: Velocity is 1.0 m/s.
Determine final speed of rod b: Speed is 1.0 m/s.
Calculate final velocity of rod b: Velocity is 1.0 m/s.
Determine final speed of rod b: Speed is 1.0 m/s.
Since rods remain perpendicular to rails and maintain good contact, final speed of rod b is 1.0 m/s.
